algorithm

Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithm.Solver

  • public class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will solve the shortest path in the graph using Dijkstra's algorithm

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Solver(Vertex[][] graph, int testAmount, boolean printPath)
      Constructs a new solver class to run Dijkstra's algorithm on a graph

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vertex getGoal() 
      Vertex[] getPath()
      Returns an array, which contains all of the tiles, that get stepped on when navigating the shortest path.
      Vertex[] getPathArray() 
      void solve()
      Executes the pathfinding algorithms and prints how long they took in milliseconds
      void solveWithAStar()
      Runs the A* algorithm using Chebyshev distance as its heuristic, logs the execution time and prints the path found by the algorithm if set so.
      void solveWithBellmanFord()
      Runs the Bellman-Ford algorithm, logs its execution time and prints the path if set so.
      void solveWithDijkstra(boolean stopAtGoal)
      Runs the Dijkstra's algorithm set amount of times, logs its execution time and prints the path if set so.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Solver

        public Solver(Vertex[][] graph,
              int testAmount,
              boolean printPath)
        Constructs a new solver class to run Dijkstra's algorithm on a graph
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph from the labyrinthGenerator
        testAmount - how many times algorithms are repeated. Timing starts at the beginning of the first run and stops after the last. Higher number will increase the timing difference between algorithms.
        printPath - true will print the path found by the algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • solve

        public void solve()
        Executes the pathfinding algorithms and prints how long they took in milliseconds

      • solveWithDijkstra

        public void solveWithDijkstra(boolean stopAtGoal)
        Runs the Dijkstra's algorithm set amount of times, logs its execution time and prints the path if set so.
        Parameters:
        stopAtGoal - Set to true if stopping execution when finding the goal vertex. False will run through entire graph

      • solveWithAStar

        public void solveWithAStar()
        Runs the A* algorithm using Chebyshev distance as its heuristic, logs the execution time and prints the path found by the algorithm if set so.

      • solveWithBellmanFord

        public void solveWithBellmanFord()
        Runs the Bellman-Ford algorithm, logs its execution time and prints the path if set so.

      • getPath

        public Vertex[] getPath()
        Returns an array, which contains all of the tiles, that get stepped on when navigating the shortest path.
        Returns:
        the array which contains all tiles in the shortest path that are walked on from start to goal

      • getPathArray

        public Vertex[] getPathArray()

      • getGoal

        public Vertex getGoal()
